Detailed Description

Abstraction layer for host specific audio I/O.

Porting this API to an embedded target system will allow the SPMIDI example programs to be played without modification. This interface is based on a blocking write model, which is the standard model for Unix audio drivers.

Because these are only used by the example programs you can use a different model, for example a callback model, when integrating SP-MIDI with your system software.

Author:

Prepare the audio device for output at the desired sample rate.

Parameters:
frameRate Commonly referred to as the "sample rate", eg. 44100 or 22050.
samplesPerFrame The number of samples played simultaneously in a frame. For stereo this would be 2.
Returns:
Negative error code or zero.

int SPMUtil_WriteAudioBuffer (  SPMIDI_AudioDevice  device,
short *  audioSamples,
int  numFrames
) 
 

Write a block of audio samples to the device.

The function should not return until all of the audio has been played or copied to an internal buffer.

Parameters:
audioSamples Pointer to first sample in the buffer to be played.
numFrames Number of frames to be written. For stereo this would be (numSamples/2).
Returns:
Negative error code or zero.
